questions.question: Anybody who wants to ……………………. join the club.
questions.description: We use can to express theoretical possibility.

questions.question: I ………………………… have won the race if I hadn’t fallen.
questions.description: We can use could to talk about unrealized past ability.

questions.question: We …………………….. go camping in June.
questions.description: We do not use can to talk about future probability.

questions.question: I was so angry I …………………………. have slapped him.
questions.description: We use could to talk about unrealized past ability.

questions.question: One day, it …………………………. be possible to travel to other planets.
questions.description: We use will be able to talk about future possibilities.

questions.question: Chennai …………………………. be very warm throughout the year.
questions.description: We often use can to talk about what is common or typical of a place.

questions.question: War ………………………… break out any day.
questions.description: We use can/could to talk about theoretical possibility.

questions.question: Who ……………………………. be at the door?
questions.description: We use can in questions to talk about the logical possibility.

questions.question: ‘Where is Janet?’ ‘She …………………………. be at John’s place.’
questions.description: Can is not used in affirmative clauses to talk about logical possibility.

questions.question: ‘Where ……………………….. we go?’
questions.description: We use shall to ask for suggestions.

questions.question: I ……………………….. see somebody coming.
questions.description: To talk about seeing at a particular moment, we often use can see.

questions.question: I can’t help but wonder what we ………………………… do next.
